problem.markdown:
>>For the beam bridge example we used a beam with a solid rectangular cross-section. Would using a beam with a hollow rectangular cross-section be more or less efficient? Assume that by efficient we mean that the total volume of material would be less.<< ( ) A hollow rectangular cross-section would be less efficient (x) A hollow rectangular cross-section would be more efficient ( ) A hollow rectangular cross-section would be equally efficient
[explanation] Using a hollow rectangular cross-section would result in more of the mass of the cross-section being further from the center. The hollow cross-section would have a higher moment of inertia and would be better able to resist bending and would thus has a smaller required cross-sectional area and volume.
